definition: reluctant (to leave, to let go etc)
to feel attached to/to long for/to love

sentences.english: So I now also is reluctant to part with self-introduction, not willing to abandon.
sentences.chinese: 所以我现在还对自我介绍恋恋不舍，不愿抛弃。

sentences.english: Therefore, I reluctantly looked back, it is a desolate lies.
sentences.chinese: 所以我恋恋不舍回头张望，绿水青山却是一片苍凉。

sentences.english: I am still attached to my hometown.
sentences.chinese: 我依然对我的家乡恋恋不舍。

sentences.english: Tom is reluctant to part with his home.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆对他的家恋恋不舍。

sentences.english: I am also a good monkey bird chasing away, looking at my pocket reluctantly .
sentences.chinese: 那只小猴还追我好远，望着我的口袋恋恋不舍的。

sentences.english: Sky in a fireworks were blossoming open, we have one of the people sorry to see him go.
sentences.chinese: 天地面一朵朵礼关闭，我们一家恋恋不舍地离去了。

sentences.english: He is still carrying the torch for his old sweetheart.
sentences.chinese: 他仍然对他的旧情人恋恋不忘。
你说是看《贱女孩》还是《恋恋笔记本》呢？

sentences.english: She wore ribbons in her black hair and clung to her dreams.
sentences.chinese: 她在黑头发上系着红缎带，恋恋不舍自己的梦。

sentences.english: The couple tore themselves away from London.
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩儿恋恋不舍地离开伦敦。

sentences.english: Sometimes they attached themselves to him.
sentences.chinese: 有时候它们恋恋不舍地跟着他。

sentences.english: August is the month of Fall, which comes the harvest.
sentences.chinese: 八月份原本就是一个憧憬和无奈，又恋恋不舍的月份。

sentences.english: Today, my boyfriend and I watched "The Notebook".
sentences.chinese: 今天我和男朋友一起看了《恋恋笔记本》。
